6. James Marsh-Holschen

# James Marsh-Holschen

## About James

James grew up in Spokane, Washington before attending law school in DC where he met his wife Alexis, who was born and raised in Broomfield. After graduation in 2013, James and Alexis decided to make Broomfield their home, purchasing Alexis' childhood home in Brandywine, where they are raising his three older children and their two young children. They are proud to call Broomfield home and have their children attend the same neighborhood schools as Alexis.

## Education

BAs in Political Science and Economics, 2008 - Eastern Washington University.  
JD, 2013 - Georgetown University Law Center

## Professional Background

Anti-Money Laundering Analyst for a financial services corporation that contracts with financial institutions to monitor client accounts for fraud and money laundering.

## Political/Community Experience

- Volunteered with the Longmont Community Justice Partnership, working on restorative justice with juvenile offenders
- Volunteered with Adams 12 Leadership Academy
- Broomfield Health and Human Services Advisory Committee
- Broomfield Local Licensing Authority
- Board of Equalization (BOE)
- Parks, Recreation and Senior Services Advisory Committee
- Colorado Municipal League (CML) Policy Committee
- Metro Area County Commissioners (MACC)

## Hobbies &amp; Interests

James enjoys spending time with his family and engaging in DIY home projects. He also enjoys historical non-fiction and watching 49ers football.
